subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0020_01C9D5F3.65042730

I am always happy to listen, whether I can hear it or not. :)

  ----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
  From: James W. Hyslope 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 9:35 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you he=
ar is what you get





  Yes April, I have the same belief as you.....if E=
VP's are of the personal nature, no matter if they yell into the microphone=
....if you are not the intended receiver you will NEVER hear or understand =
it. I do know my EVP's are very LOW audio. I need to work with that and AMP=
 them I guess. In some recordings (1927 is one of them) I can't hear the vo=
ice sometimes, that is how low it is. But tonight I finished my comparison =
recorder evaluations (ran 3 recorders that night) my Sony ICD B7 also heard=
 the date. The Panasonic RR-US360 could not hear it. I will upload a GET-OU=
T evp that the RR-DR60 only heard too. Was recorded same time as the asking=
 of date.As for "what kind of ears I have" :) I do have pretty good hearing=
 (but have some loss in certain areas) maybe my losses are closer to the st=
atic's level and I am helped there....I don't know yet. I have seen enough =
people (half) that I personally let hear these....they can't hear them eith=
er (some of them) so I understand why others can't hear them. Just to "loop=
" (continual repeat) of only the evp is helpful sometimes. --- In EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@..." <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:
  >
  > It m=
ight just make a difference if we knew what shape dem ears of yurns' are! L=
OL
  > Al
  > ---------- Original Message ----------
  > From: "April Aberc=
rombie" <april@...>
  > To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
  > Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
  > Date: Fri, 15 May 2009 14:20:30=
 -0600
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > LOL! ----- Original Message ----- From: Frank Sum=
ption To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 2:14 PMSubject=
: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
  > I always listen to EV=
P wiht my ears!--I know--alien humor.
  > 
  > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 1:24=
 PM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:
  > 
  > 
  > I always listen to =
EVP's with high quality headphones. In the "tomorrow let you know" EVP, I d=
o hear something....just can't be sure that it is a voice. I does have a ca=
dence similar to someone speaking, but it could just as easily be something=
 present in the environment-a natural background noise. There is no way for=
 me to tell for certain as it is just too feint. I can't make out any clear=
 words. Sure-I could probably matrix some in, but that is all it would be. =
For an EVP to be considered proof positive of spirit communication by the c=
ommunity at large, it has to be clear enough that many people hear the same=
 thing, without hints or coaxing. If you have to have high quality devices =
to make it out, it just isn't good enough. That does not mean it isn't a tr=
ue EVP, just that it isn't good enough to stand as evidence. As for the whi=
stle, it sounded like feedback to me as well, but I will have to take you w=
ord for it that you were no where near any other electronics or EMF's that =
could contribute to feedback. Even so, if I am trying to remain unbiased an=
d objective, there is no way for me to say this is a spirit, without person=
ally being with you when you caught it. The only thing I can still say abou=
t it is could be, but for me it is non conclusive. If someone does not hear=
 what you are hearing, try to remain objective and just understand that it =
isn't personal. You have to understand that with just these recordings alon=
e, there is no way to scientifically prove what you have recorded is spirit=
 communication. If you could get consistent, intelligent question and answe=
r recordings, then you would be alot closer. Here again, we are back to the=
 "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE to prove anything scientifically, unless =
you want others to completely believe in your evidence. The theory that is =
being kicked around is that some EVP's are personal, and only meant for the=
 person recording them to hear. If this is the case, no matter how clear so=
mething is to you, others may not hear it. April ----- Original Message ---=
-- From: James W. Hyslope To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, May 15,=
 2009 12:02 PMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
  > Okay=
, I can respect that. If you can't hear them then it must be either mechani=
cal (sound card or headphones)or maybe your hearing has loss in those frequ=
encies....Some of these are not very clear or loud enough too. But many wil=
l depend on your computer sound card & your headphones. I have let an older=
 man listen (in his late 60's) and he has heard most all of the audio. Same=
 with a few guys at work. Some hear them right away, and others can't until=
 I loop the actually EVP for a few tries. I personally use a Dell Latitude =
D430 to hear these. I can hear some on my cell phone. Headphones are a must=
....or you won't hear anything either way. *But some can be heard on cell p=
hone without headphones. The conversion to MP3 has also caused some loss, b=
ut I am still able to hear them when I review from this site (but I have th=
e repetive hearing syndrome in this area no doubt). Although I do have some=
 disbelief (shock) that a few of these are not discernable. Go back and lis=
ten to "tomorrow let you know" is in a gruffy-robotic melodic tone at the v=
ery end but with higher natural volume. And if you couldn't hear the whistl=
e...I would suggest the need to remove the cotton from the ear :) As for fe=
edback.....feedback from what? I only had one recorder working here. I woul=
d rather hear someone say "I" made the whistle....that would be more unders=
tandable. And is very true....if someone "tells" the group that THIS is sup=
posed to be what WAS said, then is very difficult to clear the mind to hear=
 it any other way. Kinda like trying to hum another song while a different =
one is playing :) --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <apri=
l@> wrote:
  > >
  > > Here's the thing though - if you put something out t=
here, and ask people to listen to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be =
in agreement, and some won't, no matter what.
  > > 
  > > If EVP messages =
are for the one that recorded them, then it shouldn't surprise you, or offe=
nd you, if someone doesn't hear the same thing you do. If you don't want co=
ntrary opinions on something, then you should not give people the chance to=
 critique.
  > > 
  > > Now I could see if someone flat out said your recor=
dings were all trash, period. You would have every right to be angry, but n=
o one is saying that, at least I am not saying that.
  > > 
  > > I just st=
ated that I did not hear what James heard, and though I wasn't going to say=
 he doesn't have anything, I can't say that he does either.
  > > 
  > > --=

mes to tell everyone what another researhcer's voices really say. I think E=

ense, except there's enough to show that there is a phenomenon. 
  > >

 > I get really tired of these self proclaimed experts trying to dicate wha=
t's acceptable.
  > >

09 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@> wrote:
  > > 
  > > 
  > > 
  > > 
  > > I=
 opened your folder and examined all your files.
  > > 
  > > Here are my o=
pinions (I have truncated the file names due to laziness):
  > > 
  > > ahh=
_mmm noises, no speech
  > > call_us noises, no speech
  > > cal_us (enhanc=
ed) several listenings: pixelated, no speech
  > > compare_panasonic noises=
, no speech
  > > compare_sony noises, no speech
  > > first_epv noises, no=
 speech
  > > good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
  > > hey_can=
 noises, no speech
  > > hey_whats noises, no speech
  > > I_hit noises, no=
 speech
  > > important_date noises, no speech
  > > keep_moving several li=
stenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
  > > laugh_evp noises, no speech
  > > lets=
_wait several listenings: noises, no speech
  > > maybe_gun noises, no spee=
ch
  > > miss_you noises, no speech
  > > my_question several listenings: n=
o da lee
  > > oh_ noises, no speech
  > > something several listenings: no=
ises, no speech
  > > that_mans noises, no speech
  > > that's_jim noises, =
no speech
  > > this_one several listenings: noises, no speech
  > > tomorr=
ow noises, no speech
  > > 
  > > The ones that took several listenings I t=
hought I might hear words in, so I examined those several times. Sometimes =
I could sort of hear something that sort of sounded like what you suggested=
, but I could also hear it in other ways, or not at all.
  > > 
  > > So my=
 suggestion to you, if you want to get less subjective conjuctures or simpl=
y less affirmations of your own interpretations, is to post the future ones=
 without labels. The labels you give can influence the listeners: when you =
have a sound that could be several things, and you note that it sounded lik=
e "keep it moving", the listener can find it nearly impossible to try NOT t=
o hear what you heard, and so not be able to give a fresh perspecive to hel=
p your research methods. 
  > > 
  > > 
  > > 
  > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@> wrote:
  > > >
  > > > Go to my =
Folder in the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs =
to) decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of the serious type. In my shor=
t time I have gathered enough "proof" for myself that this method works for=
 ME. And from what I have seen from others that I have let "listen" to my f=
iles (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" to HEAR very low audio artif=
acts....so this will help me in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to r=
each my goals (or help others) with their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPP=
IER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday.=
...it missed a few evp's real close together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony =
ICD-B7 heard a male use a different number than what I used. I said 16 (my =
earlier age I was saying in recorder) and the male evp said 13....then a fe=
male laughs. All this was missed by the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in =
both recorders) BUT then the DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end=
 of the 5 second clip....the DR60 heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) mal=
es voice. So this is very promising piece of evidence for me. **those 2 rec=
ordings have been uploaded to my folder. I will include an Olympus W-10 (so=
on as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80=
 to go with my RR-QR100, and one more (can't remember what brand-model of t=
his last---due to arrive) LOL. I need to build a multiple mounting devise t=
o aid in putting these into tandem service. Then I think I will use my Olym=
pus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder....by using it on the HQ settings. I am =
looking to build a "subsonic" microphone also (something to do with those l=
ow "booms" that I have noticed lead or follow many evp's). So I look forwar=
d to any ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
